title: BBC Local Live: Channel Islands on Friday 15 December 2017 - BBC News
summary: deputy david de lisle resigns from education role .
inter-island ferry : operators can submit their plans .
jersey development levy debate 'a waste of time ' .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 07:00 on monday .

documents.title: our coverage across the week
text: our coverage across the channel islands has finished for this week .
we 'll be back on monday from 07:00 with the latest news , weather , travel and sport .
do n't forget bbc channel islands news on bbc one at 22:30 and to get the latest news for your area from the bbc .
we hope you enjoy your weekend .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: top guernsey civil servant resigns
text: one of the most senior civil servants working for the states of guernsey has left his job unexpectedly .
chris williams , chief secretary to the committee for economic development announced he was leaving earlier on friday .
in a statement the states of guernsey chief executive , paul whitfield , says he can not comment on the reason why mr williams is leaving .
he said he will be replaced by steve wakelin , the current chief strategy and policy officer for the states of guernsey .
mr whitfield says this is an interim appointment and will help ensure continuity within the department until a permanent replacement can be appointed .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: staying dry with clear spells into tomorrow
text: tonight will probably stay stay dry with clear spells .
the winds will continue to ease and it will turn chilly in some sheltered locations .
minimum temperature : 5c ( 41f )
tomorrow the odd shower is possible but for most it will be a dry day with sunny intervals , and with much lighter winds .
maximum temperature : 8c ( 46f )
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: tweet on the beat : novel approach to christmas decorations
text: guernsey police 's criminal investigations department is currently investigating 10 sexual offences , 14 burglaries and seven fraud cases .
so it 's no surprise they had to find a quick solution to decorating their christmas tree .
our criminal investigations department currently has 45 investigations on the go .
this includes 10 sexual offences investigations , 14 burglaries 7 fraud cases & 7 drug-related enquiries .
the cid team has also taken a novel approach to decorating their office tree this christmas !
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: £ 4.55m found for fort demolition
text: decaying and dangerous sections of fort regent - some of which have been derelict for almost three decades - are finally to be removed after ministers found millions of pounds to tackle an issue that has plagued jersey politics for years .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: jersey nightclub fined £ 50k for anti-social behaviour
text: the havana nightclub has been fined £ 50,000 by jersey 's licensing assembly after `` anti-social behaviour and disorder '' from its patrons .
the case was brought by the attorney general to the assembly due to concerns from the states of jersey police licensing unit .
officers said `` a disproportionate amount of police resources '' had to be assigned to the club , on halkett street in st helier .
the bailiff and jurats heard between 22 may 2016 and 25 march 2017 there were 12 incidents of drunk and disorderly behaviour by the club 's patrons .
as opposed to suspending or removing the club 's license , a larger fine was imposed by the assembly .
a report on the hearing said further penalties were not put in place as there had been `` considerable improvement '' in management since the case was first brought to court in june 2017 .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: tweet on the beat : fraud , shoplifting and a knuckle duster
text: guernsey police are live tweeting the actions , incidents and activities their officers come across during an average working friday .
this is running from 15:00 today to 03:00 tomorrow morning .
so far we 've found out that :
that is after less than an hour of the 12-hour live tweeting marathon .
one of the responsibilities of customs and excise is to control the import and export of goods in freight .
this is to identify dutiable and prohibited or restricted goods at the ports and post office .
earlier today officers examined container freight imported from portsmouth .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: who has the best bbc christmas jumper ?
text: it 's the most wonderful time of the year , and it 's up to you to decide - which of your bbc channel islands teams have the best christmas jumpers ?
you can send your choice to us here .
author: BBC Channel Islands News

documents.title: alderney is easing itself free from the blight of plastics
text: alderney has been confirmed as the second plastic-free community by surfers against sewage .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: russia a 'risk ' to undersea cables , defence chief warns
text: the uk 's most senior military officer has warned of a new threat posed by russia to communications and internet cables that run under the sea .
a ship dragging its anchor cut three undersea internet cables connecting the channel islands to the uk last year , resulting in slower internet connections and phone problems across the islands .
air chief marshal sir stuart peach , the chief of the defence staff , said britain and nato needed to prioritise protecting the lines of communication .
he said it would `` immediately and potentially catastrophically '' hit the economy if they were cut or disrupted .
nato had prioritised the protection of the cables `` in response to the threat posed by the modernisation of the russian navy , both nuclear and conventional submarines and ships '' , he said .
author: BBC News UK

documents.title: guernsey police begin 'tweeting on the beat '
text: for the next 12 hours guernsey police officers will be live tweeting their work .
called # tweetonthebeat , officers will share what they are doing , calls they receive and the work they do between 15:00 and 03:00 .
you can follow their actions on the guernsey police twitter account .
we 're just about to kick off our 12-hour # tweetonthebeat .
between now and 3am tomorrow we 'll bring you live updates of work being carried out across law enforcement .
today is an 'action day ' ( a focused day of activity out in the community ) so there should be lots going on .
loving this !
shows diverse range of problems.stay safe .
thanks dave !
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: children 's commissioner appointed in jersey
text: a children 's commissioner has been appointed in jersey following the recommendations of the independent jersey care inquiry .
deborah mcmillan is a former director of children 's services in the uk , police officer and teacher .
ms mcmillan is due to start her role in january 2018 .
chief minister , senator ian gorst , described the position as intended to `` influence widespread positive change for children '' in jersey .

i do not underestimate the challenges that the office of the children 's commissioner will face , but i am determined to use my term of office wisely to drive real improvements in children 's lives and in particular those most vulnerable who are in need of care , protection and support .
the position was originally proposed in the final report of the independent jersey care inquiry panel , released in july .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: sure warns customers about scam email
text: people in guernsey are being warned of a scam email claiming to come from the mobile network provider sure .
the company said a variety of emails with similar messages have been sent to islanders , asking them to verify their account details .
emails may suggest you have pending messages yet to be delivered to your inbox , or that your account settings are of out date .
sure says it would not ask for your user name or password if you 're already logged in , and would not ask for details like this via email .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: road closed until monday due to electricity cable fault
text: a road in st peter port will be closed until monday as crews continue to fix a fault in an electricity cable , the states said .
the fault caused homes to lose power earlier in the week .
doyle road - st peter port work on the electricity cable fault will continue over the weekend .
the road is

documents.title: breakingman admits £ 35k theft from charity
text: a man has admitted stealing more than £ 35,000 from jersey 's royal british legion .
dominic egre , 43 , took the money over nine years , jersey 's royal court heard .
he has been remanded on bail , and is due to be sentenced on 2 february .
author: Alison Moss
BBC Channel Islands News

documents.title: resigned deputy 'uncomfortable for some time '
text: deputy david de lisle has said he resigned from guernsey 's committee for education sport and culture because he was `` uncomfortable '' with the direction the committee had been taking `` for some time '' .
he submitted his resignation to the bailiff on thursday .
an election for a new appointment to the education , sport and culture committee is likely to be held at the january states meeting .
it comes only a few days after deputy john gollop was elected , unopposed , to the committee - filling the vacancy left by vice president carl meerveld .
deputy meerveld 's former post has been filled by deputy andrea dudley-owen , a decision made at the last states meeting of the year on thursday .
author: Simon Fairclough
Guernsey Political Reporter

documents.title: inter-island ferry firm 'could be announced by january '
text: a jersey politician has said the decision on which company will run the new inter-island ferry service in the channel islands could be announced by the end of january .
the tender process inviting businesses to put their names forward to operate the route opened earlier today .
nine businesses have already put their names forward to run it .
the chosen company will run day-trips between the islands from april or may to the end of september , starting next year .
senator lyndon farnham , who is overseeing the jersey side of the project , thinks it will be a `` quick process '' .
author: BBC Channel Islands News

documents.title: chamber of commerce welcomes new committee president
text: the president of guernsey 's chamber of commerce has welcomed the new president of the committee for economic development .
deputy charles parkinson was nominated by the states this week after the resignation of peter ferbrache last month .
he resigned after a probe into £ 300,000 being paid to a law firm bearing his name , which he said he had `` not earned a penny '' from .
martyn dorey , from guernsey chamber of commerce , said he is pleased deputy parkinson wants to diversify guernsey 's economy .
charles made a big decision to go back into politics a few years ago and one of the things i think charles wanted to make a difference to is economics .
so here we are , charles is back in front line politics .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: late departure for commodore clipper
text: the commodore clipper is running on a revised timetable after being delayed getting into portsmouth , according to condor .
having departed one hour and 47 minutes late , the clipper sailed at 10:47 and is due to arrive in jersey at 19:00 .
the service will then leave at 21:00 for guernsey , arriving at 23:00 before departing again at 00:20 for portsmouth - returning to dock at 07:50 .
condor said weather conditions were expected to improve throughout the day .
update | clipper sailed from pmth to jsy & gsy 1 hour 47 mins late at 10:47 on friday 15th december 2017 .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: shop 'may have been hit by vehicle '
text: police are appealing for witnesses after an incident where the front of a shop in st peter port may have been damaged by a vehicle .
it happened on mill street at boutique red some time between 20:00 on 7 december and 08:30 on 8 december .
officers said a large section of wood was seen hanging from the front of the shop .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'challenging ' journey for newspaper boat skipper
text: guernsey 's national newspapers took a little longer to arrive from jersey today , as the boat bringing them battled rough seas .
the channel chieftain five arrived in st peter port at 09:34 , hours later than its scheduled arrival .
skipper david nuth said it was a `` difficult call '' on whether to make the journey , with force eight northeasterly winds earlier .
he said : `` it was challenging .
we just took our time and steadily got here .

`` i left a bit later this morning because i wanted to try and do most of the journey in the daylight , because normally i do it in the darkness but i just needed to make sure i ticked a few more boxes , that 's why we 're a little bit delayed getting the papers here this morning .
`` you 've got to make sure you do n't hit any big waves , because they can weigh quite a bit , 10 , 20 tonnes a big wave , but fortunately we 're fine . ''
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: waste disposal price hike 'will not cause fly-tipping '
text: jersey 's minister for infrastructure does not think putting up the cost of disposing of green waste and commercial building waste will cause fly tipping .
the department is trebling the cost to businesses for getting rid of tree branches , grass cuttings and other kinds of garden waste .
it means gardeners and tree surgeons will have to pay £ 63 per tonne when they take it to the tip - instead of just over £ 20 .
deputy eddie noel said it was not fair for taxpayers to subsidise the work and does not expect to see more waste dumped illegally because of it .
the commercial contractors are responsible for those individuals and i 'm sure this is a cost they will be able to pass on to their customers .
if you think who their client bases are , they wo n't be ty households .
households still have the option of disposing of their green waste themselves . ''
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: watch out for christmas thieves , police warn
text: jersey police have taken to twitter to warn islanders not to leave christmas presents where they can be easily seen - as they can prove a tempting target for thieves .
christmas can be very tempting for thieves , so never leave your presents on view whether it be in your car or through your lounge window and if you see anything sus report it to us .
author: Twitter

documents.title: jersey airport expects 26,000 christmas travellers
text: large numbers of air travellers over the christmas period have led ports of jersey to advise passengers to leave extra time to check in and get through security at jersey airport .
a spokesman said from today until the 25 december the airport was expected to receive in excess of 26,000 passengers - with 3,000 of those travelling today , the busiest day of the period .
christmas eve , he added , was the `` quietest day '' in terms of passenger numbers .
many flights on `` more popular routes '' are at capacity , ports of jersey added .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: chief minister apologises for foi law extension delays
text: jersey 's chief minister has apologised in the states assembly after failing to add government owned companies to the island 's freedom of information law .
in 2014 , deputy carolyn labey asked the states to bring companies such as andium homes , the ports of jersey , jersey post and jersey water under the law , and members agreed .
but three years on , she is still waiting for it to happen .
in the last states sitting of 2017 senator ian gorst said he was `` sorry '' , and would `` endeavour to correct '' the situation .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: important regeneration 'could be abandoned ' in st helier
text: important regeneration work in st helier could be abandoned after jersey 's minister in charge of planning and environment failed to convince fellow states members to approve a tax on landowners .
deputy steve luce said he wanted to charge people selling their land a 2 % fee on any increase in value since it was approved for planning permission .
it was expected to raise between £ 1.5m - £ 2.5m if approved .
he said he was surprised that st helier deputies failed to support him - because the money would have been spent on improving their parish .
however , jersey 's chamber of commerce said the states made `` the right decision '' and it should not be up to businesses to subsidise states policies .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: newspaper boat battling weather
text: spare a thought for the crew of the channel chieftain five battling some rough seas to deliver guernsey 's national newspapers from jersey this morning .
conditions were so rough they did n't make it in yesterday .
last sunday they captured some spectacularly rough conditions on camera .
a short while ago , the vessel ( the grey boat above ) was battling the strong northwesterly winds off guernsey 's st martin 's point , expected to arrive in st peter port at 10:30 .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: # tweetonthebeat returns to guernsey police
text: guernsey police are giving islanders an insight into what they get up as the force runs its `` tweet on the beat '' campaign .
officers will be on social media posting photos and updates from call outs and emergencies , from 15:00-03:00 .
it was first launched back in 2015 and officers said feedback from the public was so positive they decided to do it again .
a spokesman said : `` we hope you 'll find this informative and engaging . ''
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: alderney marks homecoming day
text: alderney is marking the 72nd anniversary of homecoming day - a bank holiday to remember when islanders returned after world war two .
in june 1940 the entire population of the island , about 1,400 , gathered at les butes to be officially told france had fallen to the german armed forces .
they were told the islands were being demilitarised and they had to decide whether to stay or go .
all but a handful evacuated the island ahead of the occupation , which started at the end of june , carrying only what they could fit in their arms .
the germans deported those left behind to guernsey and after heavily fortifying the island , as part of hitler 's atlantic wall , began work on building four concentration camps .
a number of events are taking place to mark the day , including a ceremony at the harbour at 10:00 and a music concert at the island hall at 14:00 .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: alderney doctors seek talks with states representatives
text: a doctor in alderney has called for more communication between the island 's gp surgery and its states members .
yesterday a representative from alderney who sits in guernsey 's states assembly , louis jean , raised concerns about the island 's healthcare system .
there are two representatives from alderney who sit in guernsey 's states assembly , as well as the island 's own parliament .
the surgery recently cut costs to gp appointments for children over concerns they were not accessing primary healthcare enough .
dr sally simmons said `` very regular meetings '' would be useful .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: christmas jumper day
text: what are you up on christmas jumper day ?
email us your
was there some sort of memo to the breakfast presenters @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid must wear red jumper with reindeer !
# christmasjumperday
and former presenters got the memo too
adorable !
author: Isla Blatchford
BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: breakingdeputy david de lisle resigns from education role
text: deputy david de lisle has resigned from guernsey 's education committee .
he declined to be interviewed , but said he was `` uncomfortable with the direction the committee has been taking for some time '' .
it comes a few days after deputy john gollop was elected as a member of the education sport and culture committee .
he was elected unopposed and fills the vacancy left by vice president carl meerveld .
author: Isla Blatchford
BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: backbencher renews calls for foi law extension
text: a backbencher in jersey 's states assembly is continuing her fight for government owned companies like jersey water and andium homes to be covered under the freedom of information act .
grouville deputy carolyn labey won a debate in the states to bring the companies under the law in 2014 , but three years on she claims little has been done .
deputy labey said these companies handle public assets and must come under public scrutiny .
you can see the results of all freedom of information requests to the states of jersey here .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: fancy running an inter-island ferry service ?
text: well it 's not too late .

despite nine expressions of interest to run the jersey-guernsey ( and possibly alderney ) route , any companies yet to register interest wo n't be barred from the tender process , which starts today .

island governments are offering the opportunity for private businesses to run the subsidised passenger service , which jersey 's government says aims to encourage additional spending as visitors island hop .
details of the tender can be found here .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: gale warning in force for channel islands
text: jersey 's met department has issued another gale warning for the channel islands .
wind warning № 37/12 , issued at 02:47 utc , 15/12/2017 .
author: Twitter

documents.title: tree blocking jersey road
text: police have asked drivers to avoid la route de l'aleval in st peter because a fallen tree is blocking the road .
tree down blocking la route de l'aleval ( old german road ) near vic in the valley .
please use an alternative route .
author: Twitter

documents.title: windy start , with sunny intervals and showers
text: a very windy start to the day with sunny intervals and showers , which are likely to be heavy with some hail mixed in .
becoming drier and less windy this afternoon .
feeling cold generally , though sheltered spots like st helier and st peter port may not feel too cold in the sunshine .
maximum temperature : 9c ( 47f )
jersey :
guernsey :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : liberation inter-island trip cancelled
text: strong winds and high waves have forced condor ferries to cancel some sailings today .
this morning 's liberation departure from poole had been delayed , now expected to arrive in guernsey at 14:00 , before going on to jersey at 14:30 .
there wo n't be a scheduled sailing back to guernsey , instead it will return to poole .
today 's jersey to st malo services have been cancelled .
all guernsey to sark sailings have been cancelled today with the exception of this morning 's 08:00 sailing from guernsey , returning from sark at 09:00 .
author: BBC Channel Islands News

documents.title: jersey 's all-weather lifeboat is back with temporary crew
text: jersey 's all-weather lifeboat is now able to provide lifesaving cover during extreme weather - after the rnli drafted in a standby crew .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: restructured fund raises £ 80m for health investment
text: a uk health care business has raised more than £ 80m through a local fund .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: development levy debate 'a waste of time '
text: jersey 's government has been defeated in its attempt to make landowners pay a fee if their land is approved for planning .
one deputy suggested the plans for an infrastructure levy , scrapped yesterday , were a `` waste of time '' .

the environment minister wanted landowners to pay a small percentage of the increase in value when selling land after its received planning approval , but there was opposition from the construction industry and the states decided it should n't become law in a vote yesterday .

i do n't think it 's right for this states assembly , so close to an election time , to turn around and say we agree to something in principle , charge the minister to actually go away and ask the law officers to start drawing up legislation which could potentially just be a waste of time because then the new states assembly comes in and says 'we do n't even want to look at it ' ''
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: inter-island ferry : operators can submit their plans
text: companies can bid to run the new passenger-only ferry service between guernsey and jersey from today .
the successful operator will provide day trips between the islands , for local residents , tourists and commuters .
last week , island governments were criticised for their slow action by two operators interested in running the subsidised route .
it will run from the beginning of may to the end of september , starting in 2018 .
the successful bidder will have the option of providing an additional service to alderney , which it 's understood may get some funding from the states of alderney .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for friday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for the channel islands today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online
